text: CLOSE Gold medal winner Jordyn Wieber speaks about sexual assault legislation during a press conference on Monday, Feb. 26, 2018, at the Michigan state Capitol in Lansing. Olympian and sexual assault survivor Jordyn Wieber answers a question on Thursday, March 22, 2018, at the Pasant Theatre on the Michigan State University campus in East Lansing. Wieber's speaking event, titled ` ` Moving Forward,'' focused on women and survivor empowerment. ( Photo : Nick King / Lansing State Journal ) WASHINGTON â€“ Olympic gold medal gymnast Jordyn Wieber, a Lansing - area native, described for a U. S. Senate panel on Wednesday the sexual abuse she suffered at the hands of sports doctor Larry Nassar beginning at age 14,
